reviewText:
Early Access Review

Edit, 07.01.2016: In short: So the energy system is gone, since there were many negative reviews stating precisely that this kind of mechanic does not belong on steam. (Good work people. Speak out that we do not want steam to become a semi-Facebook.) Hence, I edited parts of my review. But in sum, I still find the game to be too repetetive, shallow and cannot overlook the fact that you can only craft a tiny amount of free stuff, while there is a p2w marketsystem in place aswell. Again: I'd rather pay for customization, knowing that we all have the same chances, than paying for superiority.

+ Fallout-esque artwork. The maps look alot like a polished Fallout 1 or 2. Or a apocalpse-themed Jagged Alliance 2.
+ Turn-based combat. Every team has 20 seconds for its actions. Thats more than enough, keeps the game at a great pace and opens various strategy options.
+ Lots of skills already. You can upgrade your merc with exp and ingame currency. So you do not have to spend any dime to advance. You can freely choose how to spent the exp. Also, when your merc levels up, you can spend 3 points per level on his abilities to upgrade him or her even more.
+ 5 different classes. Sniper, tank, scout, medic/tank and grunt.
+ Tactical gameplay on different maps. You will probably see some of the maps but currently their are not too many gamemodes.
+ Short loading times. There is barely no loading time. You can hop in and out without having to wait a longer period of time.
+ Nice soundtrack. Even if I do not understand a word, I can still feel that the soundtrack fits into the game and compliments it.

- Ingame cash for superior items. Cash items do have better stats and give great advantages over regular items. Like better evasion, higher damage output, more health, you name it. Sort of pay 2 win" or "pay 4 advantages".
- Limited Energy mechanic. Not sure why this is in place. While you can buy the ingame currency
date: gold and premium time with real money
recommended: there is also a limited amount of energy. That means
voteText: a battle costs 5 energy units
helpfulPercent: traveling the map costs energy units. I did not make it to the limit
votesHelpful: but it confuses me that its even there.\n- Low playerbase. I know this game just launched
votesTotal: but with the current playerbase its hardly fun. Most of the times
votesFunny: each team has one real player and the rest is filled up with bots. Yes
commentsCount: bots. There is no way around them unless you want to wait 4 hours for the matchmaking. But the A.I. is really annoying since they will constantly run into their deaths and feed the enemy team. So
column16: after all is does not make a huge difference if you play in any tactical way.\n- Capture mode is a pain in the bottom and has nothing to do with strategy. Its basically spamming spawns
column17:
rushing to the capture point and standing next to each other spamming AOE damage. Thats not fun. Not at all.
- Grindy. Very grindy. That would not be a problem if the matches were engaging and exciting. But since you basically shoot bots all the time it quickly becomes a mind-numbing process.

In sum: While there is a great game that could be alot of fun
column18: there are various mechanics that do not feel right at all. Instead of paying for customization
column19: like in LoL or other games where the items are strictly only cosmetics
column20: you can buy better items with real money. You could also get those items by playing the game and logging in daily
column21: but it would probably take a year and you would always be the "worse equipped" merc in your rated game. Also
column22: the energy mechanic makes no sense at all. Why make the player pay for items aswell as for playtime? So after you bought an item
column23: you still have a limited period of time until you have to either close the game or pay more money. With that mechanic
column24: I don't understand how the playerbase shall grow
column25: since many players will have to shut down their game and will eventually be annoyed.\nLike other players stated
column26: features like this are known for facebook or such but do not make sense on steam. I'd rather pay to customize my merc in a non-p2w way than have to pay to keep up and to keep playing. So
column27: I cannot really recommend this game
column28: even if it looks so gorgeous and could be so much fun."

Gameplay wise? live action TBS game where each side players take turns at will and then rest" while waiting for there team mates to finish. Then its the other sides turn. Thats ok and so is the combat its sorta like a stop and go FPS with people trying to get in range
recommended: or in cover. That part is fun... unless the other team has bought ♥♥♥♥ from the store which gives them a distintive advantage... then its not so much fun.  Again thou all of this is a joke thou when you can only spend so little time playing before the energy runs out and you have to wait to play again and we all know the nature of energy mechanic dependant games now dont we? after seeing them on the mobile so much we know that actions will cost more and more and your energy pool will not increase or does so little that in the end your forced to pay money to reset the energy so you can play again. sounds like fun? like i said then have at this otherwise PASS"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Decided to update this review to match current changes:

Pay 2 win was made stronger.  Why pay to win, when you can pay more, and never lose due to extremely overpowered gear.

No balance. The small fraction of balance the game did have, was removed.  Now there is no form of balance at all.  New players will face off against maxed out p2w players simply because the game has lost most of it's player base.

Good game idea, extremely poor execution. And each patch moves the game in a worse direction.  This is a prime example of what happens when you only listen to the pay 2 win russian players.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

a pretty nice little game, kinda reminds me of the old fallout

pros:
- great time waster
- nice soundtrack
- gameplay that will not let you be bored
- a couple of classes to choose from, you can choose your playstyle
- strategy-based combat, requires teamwork in order to win, however there arent much players right now so this kinda doesnt count
- clan-battles

cons:
- grindfest
- you can buy power-ups before a match that give you +20% HP, +15% DMG, etc... which makes it kinda pay2win, please note that with enough teamwork this isnt too hard to overcome by f2p players.
- in the current state of the game, there is not much content, but the game just came out today, so there will likely be updates
- as of right now there are not much players, and most of the matches youll have 90% of the mercenaries being played by bots
- a stupid energy-system, you cannot play anymore if your energy is empty, you have to wait until it recovers.
- you can buy a premium account for a couple of days, which basically makes you a demi-god, now THIS is pay2win

i see lots of potential within this game, i really hope it can get better, but i still do recommend it, since its really fun to try out!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What I like most about the game is the bright overhead style graphics. It is very similar to the classic Fallout games, which I loved because of the graphics and turn-based game play.
If it's possible, the main recommendation I have is I would love to play a solo quest mode, where I can use the characters to go to different locations to complete different objects and hunting various bounties in the form of boss characters.
There should also be a Free-For-All battle mode in which all the players in the game can gunsling with each other without being on teams.
Or maybe a hunting mode in which players are all trying to hunt one bounty head that is elusive and running around the game map meking it harder to catch. The bounty can be a bot set to evade and only attacks when necessary. Multilple player can attack each other while trying to be the first to catch the evading bounty head.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I thorougly enjoyed being thrown into the world with little instruction. Highlights of my time here include; Rage, Furious masturbation to the incessent and unrelenting music, Oh how I long to hear that russian Beauty sing that ♥♥♥♥ing song one more time. Don't let me get started on the eurphoric effect of hearing the same Gun shot sound when hovering over your mecenary. I like how you kept the menus nice and basic. In this awkward mashup of X-COM and Fallout with it's Fallout Tactics look. I want to wholeheartedly thank the devs for tossing me into a battle of the Gods during my first battle.
Excellent way to burn time in this Pay to Wi- I mean 'Freemium' game. Before the battle you have the option to buy OP upgrades not to meantion the lack of progrssion, you get two standard gears to buy in the store, roughly progressing, from 5k hear to 10k gear, then suddenly it cuts off and  youre forced to buy gear for an INSANE 50k + What the ♥♥♥♥! NOT TO MENTION THE AI IS ♥♥♥♥ING STUPPPIDDDD. Some players NAMELY SCOUTS RUN IN WITH NO REGARD FOR LIFE, The cover system is pointless unless youre a sniper.

To their credit, Each class relies on the other class, eg. Snipers rely on scouts to provide vision, and Scouts rely on cover fire from snipers etc. And then there are the tanks, nuff said, nobody targets the tanks because they are giant walls of health that miss every ♥♥♥♥ing shot and should only be attacked when desperate.

Final verdict: 4/10. Maybe in another life.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is fun for the most part but absolutely lacks balance in its mechanics. Especially on the maps where people who 'reset' their generations to get bonus attribute points but have to re-earn their skills/rank... literally can enter lower level areas of the map and gank endless low levels with the elite gear they have on their character. Completely destroys balance what so ever.

On a better note you do get to enjoy a somewhat decent combat system in this game once you figure out how to use cover and the skills related to your character class. So for the most part its rather fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is one of those games that will make you feel nostalgic to the core. It reminds me of games like Jagged Alliance and Fallout:Tactics, the amount of content is great and adds a ton of replay value. The only thing that I can see being an issue is the pay to win items you could get in the game, this throws balance out the window and can cause the game to be difficult for casual players.

In terms of game play itself it's spot on and to the point, I still feel as though this particular game should be an iPhone or droid game mainly because it's simple and to the point. This doesn't hurt the game in the least. If you enjoy a good sci-phi strategy game this is your game.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The good parts:
x) it is  turn based game, which is IMHO rare these days, but what I like cause I am not that much of a 'shoot fast and exact' guy.
x) The game idea is nice too.. very Firefly-like.
x) you get a low but ok amount of gold by leveling or rndom daily rewards (premiumingame currency)
if there are not enough players for a battle, ranks are filled with robots. players can join in at a later time still
x) beginner equipoement can be made rather cheaply
x) most equipment can be upgraded, some upgrades for higher end stuff require gold though

And then come the bad parts:
x) a lot of translation problems (some descriptions are simply false in english)
x) a lot of crashes, especially at the end of battles (about once an hour) , which, at least for me, often enough result in receiving no rewqards (no exp, no Wulong, which are the ingame non premium money)
x) mathmaking sets you often up against players with (way superior) premium gear and/or way higher level this.
x) premium equipement is simply overpowered and forcing you to buy premium gear yoursefl if you do not want to live through a lot of being stomped experiences (which ruin the game after a week or so, at least for me)
x) premium gear is simply ridiculously overpriced (about 100€ for non upgraded top end gear per piece)

as a result I can say although it would be a very nice game concerning the idea and playmodes, Although you have games which you can easily win with your standard non premium gear there are times of day when you simply better not play if you do not want to get stomped by overpowered opponents.

So if you do not mind massive cash injections I cannot recomend this game at all

but the big thing is the game would rather match you against the bots and botters (which are endless) than actual players...  Single player esque pay to win small map dumb ai version of Jagged Alliance. Steer clear, maybe try frozen Snyapse

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*PEW PEW*

((DISCLOSURE))
Has P2W (PAY to WIN) elements such as overpowered guns costing lots of in-game currency that can be bypassed with real money. You can grind in game currency for those guns at a fairly slow rate. The game features an unlocking system, the more battles you fight in you unlock new pieces of gear which you can then purchase with in-game currency or real money.
((DISCLOSURE))

The gameplay is fun albeit a bit mindless at lower levels especially without getting any extra skills for your class. There seems to be 5 classes, they all seem to play a bit differently, but most of them have the same goal, KILL THE OTHER TEAM.

I played two different classes and they were both fun (sniper, and dual pistol). Sniper is vey enjoyable to play as and is more of a setup shop in a defensive or secluded position and take long range shots from across the field. The dual pistol user was good too with a more run-n-gun style of shooting, where you want to get up close in personal shoot down someone and then run away as fast as possible.

There is a crafting system, a training system for when you aren't playing the game, and pretty much all the amenities of a leveling system in a RPG.

The game was fun despite the P2W elements. I look forward to playing this some more in the future.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I dont know what Gunslingers is really, but I do know its pretty fun. I havent really played a turn based isometric shooter like it. Gunslingers has this western/ post apocalyptic feel to it a decent sound track, and gameplay that I find simple, but also enjoyable. What it comes down to is taking your mercenarys into battle, each one has a different class and thus different equipable weapons and skills.

The games are turn based between teams, the objective depends on the game mode, I have seen capture the point, king of the hill, and team death match type game modes so far.  Aside from what I have gone over, the general feel" of the game
date: I can atleast say the one biggest negative I see so far is lack of content. something early access will hopefully fix."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alright 1st review. Here we go.
Gunslingers is...basically X-Com, but not X-Com. Ya know?
It loads pretty quickly, faster than most browser games I know of.
It's basically a
X-com PvP Game with no Aliens. Everyone's a mercenary. So I'll list the good.
Pros-
Nice and simple. Open game. click Battle, choose mercenary, grab some items, join game.
It's alrightish BGM for the lobby area type thing.
Graphics aight.
Gives you some AFK system type thing where you can send your peeps to do some stuff for extra XP, money, or upgrade money (???).
John (the first dude you get, the sniper) He's pretty OP.
Leto (the medic) She's also OP.
Matches end quickly

Now...the not so good.
Cons:
Leto's OP. She's the medic. she can camp behind someone, and heal them all day...or herself and hardly die.
John's OP. He's the sniper. He can camp as far as needed, go into Sniper mode and hit you for 130-140 damage a turn.
Scout girl isn't fun at low levels, don't use her. Just send her for EXP.
Robot is just robot.
Other guy...who even uses him.
Oh, you have to get Gold to unlock them. Not in-game money. Real Cash money. The 3 others, (Leto, Robot, and Other Guy)
It's basically P2W.
BOTS. OH MY GOD. BOTS RUIN THIS GAME. oh no they don't" OH YES THEY DO. BOTS RUN FORWARD
date: NOT IN COVER. RUN RIGHT TO THE MIDDLE
recommended:
EVERYONE ELSE ♥♥♥♥ING KILLS THEM. GG. Do you know how not fun that is?
Scenario:
14-14 Team Deathmatch(whatever it's called).
Bot runs in (From your team)
hoursPlayed:
gets blown up. You lose. Half the time they're just scout bots dying over and over.

TL;DR - P2W PvP Mercenary Pew Pew With Bots
I'd give it a maybe."
voteText: December 22, 2015

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Gunslingers itself is fun,I enjoyed it when the matchmaking system actually gave us even geared teammates and opponents (which may explain why we only won two matches) But the micro transactions are too prevalent to ignore. Would I recommend this game to my friends currently, maybe depending on whether they can deal with the micro transactions, would I recommend this game if the micro transactions were removed or even balanced? Absolutely. Hopefully with this game being in early access, they will respond to the community’s gripes with them and remove them, because this game has potential to be good, real good. Check out the full review at http://imagengames.com/gunslingers-mercs-for-sale/

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe developers have fell off the face of the planet. The game will suck you in, then you start buying more mercenaries and by the second time you'll be bored to death of the same exact grind fest using the same exact strategy every time. This is not much for a strategy game. I was hoping the features in this game would improve but it's been nearly 2 months without a single peep from the developers. Ontop of that, the developers are ghosts. If you try to find their website or anything about this game you can't. After I scrubbed the net for a bit, I found a website for some of their other games and it had their logo. I requested a refund from them because I litetrally wasted $10 buying gold ingots like a ♥♥♥♥♥ and have maybe played the game for 13 solid hours since that purchase. Why'd I stop? I got bored to death. I literally felt like playing the game was a punishment for having poorly spent my money on this piece of junk. Play it for free, enjoy it for a few days or hours. But, don't spend money on this piece of crap until the developers grow a spine and maybe some semblance of a heart. See how many hours I wasted on this game? We all make mistakes. Learn from mine.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWhile it looks like a decent game at first it gets boring real fast. Like many Free
date: but pay to play" games it suffers from numerous flaws limiting playability for those who are not ready to dig into their wallets. The availability of equipment and additional hirelings is non-existant or extremely unless you shell out real bucks. The turn based interface is slow and sometimes non-responsive. The AI controling the non-player controlled characters is dumber then an intellectually challenged kumquat.  You get to control only one character
recommended: so all your team is AI controlled. This means all your team is usually slaughtered as they rush directly into automatic fire without thought for cover. The enemy tend not to be as dumb. Also very limited carrying capacity means you are quickly out of medkits and/or grenages.  The only real way to get money and EXP at first is long (8 Hr) farming sessions in the "job" section during which you may as well watch grass grow for excitement. Even after the rewards are limited so multiple farmign sessions are required to get equipment and skills increased.  Finally
hoursPlayed: the extremely bad Russian singing in the background does not add to the appeal
voteText: might as well have a recording of a cat being molested/tortured. Luckily I did not spend any money on this

Early Access Review

I think I have given it a fair shakes, and I can say that the game is extremely Pay2Win in this stage.
I had a rather frustrating game against the Medic, where my entire team piled onto a single medic, yet we couldn't kill her. Her heal, once factored for shots missing, can overcome damage from an entire non-paying team.

The game system has pretty good potential, very catchy soundtrack, but the pay2win, PvP only nature really turned me off.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Some of the issues that I have with this game is the way the shop works, the p2w aspects, the lack of difficulty due to bots, and the prices for the cash shop.

The way the shop works is that you have 4 random items that spawn and refresh every 12 hours. You have no choice but to wait, watching until you find what you're looking for and this can take months for a single piece of gear.

The game is p2w but only if you want to play in the tourney, or if you're up against older players. In random battles you almost always go up against bots who's armor, health, and weapons scale with your own. This means you don't need gear at all to win most of the time.

There is no difficulty, and no need for strategy thanks to the poorly coded bots. And for the most part whichever side uses the most grenades will always win as bots don't use them.

And then there is the prices of the cash shop, which lets you buy wulong, gold, or premium time. It is expensive to buy the gold which is needed for the top gear in-game. $100 will buy you 3k gold. The best weapons in the game for each of the 5 toons cost about 1.5k-1.8k gold + 500 - 1k gold to fully upgrade. The top armor costs about 700 - 1.5k gold a piece + w/e is needed for upgrades. (or so i been told) To give you a better idea, this means it costs about $300 to fully equip 1 toon and an extra $100 is needed for each extra toon as the armor can be swapped between them.

In the past the older players where actually able to get the top gear much easier and cheaper, so a lot of the older players already have the full set of top notch gear. For the new player however, its much harder because the gold that is needed is just part of the problem, you will also have to wait for the item to show up in the shop. This can take months or even years for a full set regardless of how much gold you buy. Because you don't need gear at all to play and win against bots there is really no reason to buy gold at all.

Note: To clear up a few things I read in other reviews, there is no longer an energy mechianic it's done away with. Also a few people have played for a few hours and said you need money to unlock all the toons, this too is incorrect. While it's true that you start with 2 of 5 toons and you need 150 gold to unlock each of the other 3, you also earn free gold by playing the game and leveling up the toons you have, as well as free gold from the daily logins. You make 125 gold every time you take a toon to level 10 and you have 10 generations as well. So a f2p player can earn 1250 gold from each toon x 5 different toons for free. No real money is needed.
